alert.note: Alert for Marfa Plateau (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued October 24 at 2:47PM CDT until October 24 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING... ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, west winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 50 mph are expected. For the Freeze Watch, sub- freezing temperatures as low as 28 degrees are possible. * WHERE...Marfa Plateau. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, until 8 PM CDT today. For the Freeze Watch, from late tonight night through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
